head.title: And Now for Some Portable Seaside Attractions

hedline.hl1: And Now for Some Portable Seaside Attractions

abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on sources and prices of beach items; photos (M)

block.p: COMPACT, lightweight and colorful gear makes a day at the beach a day at the beach. And while adults search for the best insulated cooler for a picnic, children need the right equipment, too; sturdy plastic diggers help small hands dig deep holes.

1. The Backpack beach chair has insulated pockets for food and drink and an attached umbrella; $70 from Brookstone, (800) 846-3000, or www.brookstone.com. A child's beach chair with canopy comes in red, green or blue; $12.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond, (800) 462-3966 or www.bedbathandbeyond .com. 2. An oversized yellow beach towel with a 19th-century fish drawing, 52 by 72 inches, is $56 from the Martha By Mail catalog, (800) 950-7130, or www.marthabymail.com. Colorful beach towels (right) are $9.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond. 3. Diggers are $1.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond. 4. The Backpack chair, folded. 5. An inflatable cooler is $9.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond. 6. and 9. The padded Grass Blanket, one of Tibor Kalman's last designs for M&Co., is made of plastic-backed water-resistant polyester. Folded, it's a shoulder bag with an outside pocket; open, it's 56 by 58 inches and costs $60 at the MoMa Design Store, 44 West 53rd Street, (800) 793-3167, or www.momastore.org. A collapsible insulated rolling cooler, big enough to carry everything for a picnic, with three outside pockets is $79.95 from Hammacher Schlemmer, (800) 233-4800 or www.hammacherschlemmer.com. 7. A 71-inch diameter umbrella, hand-painted by the New York artists Guido and Francesca Zwicker, is $690; the chair is $250, at Pescepalla Docks Gallery, 345 Greenwich Street (Jay Street). A leaf-shaped umbrella (rear) is $29.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond. 8. Beach towels in assorted designs are 34 by 64 inches and cost $29 to $35; from the Pottery Barn Kids catalog, (800) 430-7373. 9. The grass blanket and rolling cooler, shown closed above, with white tinware plates (four for $20) and mugs (four for $16) are from Williams-Sonoma, (800) 541-2233. The plastic cutlery, available in several colors, is $1.99 a place setting at Bed, Bath & Beyond.
